cards.description: A point or period at which something occurs.
A human being regarded as an individual.
The time taken by the Earth to make one revolution around the sun.
A method or style of doing something.
A period of 24 hours.
An object, animal, or quality that is not a person.
An adult male human being.
The earth, together with all of its countries, peoples, and natural features.
The existence of an individual human being or animal.
The end part of a person's arm beyond the wrist.
A portion or division of a whole.
A young human being below the age of puberty.
The organ of sight in humans and animals.
An adult female human being.
A particular position or point in space.
Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a result.
A period of seven days.
An instance of a particular situation.
A particular spot, place, or position.
The governing body of a nation, state, or community.
A commercial business.
An arithmetical value representing a particular quantity.
A number of people or things that are located, gathered, or classed together.
A matter or situation regarded as unwelcome or harmful and needing to be dealt with.
A thing that is known or proved to be true.
A building for human habitation.
A region or part of a town, country, or the world.
An account of imaginary or real people and events told for entertainment.
A group consisting of parents and their children living together in a household.
The element of a person that enables them to be aware of the world and their experiences.
An institution for educating children.
A nation or territory considered as an organized political community under one government.
A person whom one knows and with whom one has a bond of mutual affection.
The organ that pumps blood through the circulatory system.
A man in relation to his child or children.
A woman in relation to her child or children.
A man or boy in relation to other sons and daughters of his parents.
A woman or girl in relation to other daughters and sons of her parents.
A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building.
A part or division of a building enclosed by walls.
The ability to do something or act in a particular way.
A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.
A set of written, printed, or blank pages fastened together inside a cover.
A transparent, tasteless, odorless, and nearly colorless chemical substance.
Any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink.
A paid position of regular employment.
A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine.
The natural agent that stimulates sight and makes things visible.
Vibrations that travel through the air or another medium and can be heard when they reach a person's ear.
The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen.
A sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information.
A thing said, written, or done to deal with or as a reaction to a question.
A thought or suggestion as to a possible course of action.
A thought or suggestion.
A medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes.
An intense feeling of deep affection.
The physical structure of a person or an animal.
The front part of a person’s head from the forehead to the chin.
The place where one lives.
A period of time equal to 60 minutes.
A cause, explanation, or justification.
A group of people working together.
The sound produced in a person's larynx.
An activity that one engages in for amusement or fun.
The property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye.
The region of the atmosphere and outer space seen from the earth.
The lower surface of a room.
The solid surface of the earth.
The male ruler of an independent state.
The female ruler of an independent state.
A public road in a city or town.
A wide way leading from one place to another.
A woody perennial plant.
Combustion or burning.
A large natural elevation of the earth’s surface.
A large natural stream of water.
The expanse of salt water that covers most of the earth’s surface.
A painting, drawing, or photograph.
The art of arranging sounds to create a harmonious effect.
A story or event recorded by a camera.
A series of thoughts, images, and sensations occurring in a person’s mind during sleep.
The star around which the earth orbits.
The natural satellite of the earth.
A luminous point in the night sky.
A very young child.
A large town.
A group of houses and associated buildings in a rural area.
Each of the four divisions of the year.
A living organism that feeds on organic matter.
A living organism of the kind exemplified by trees, shrubs, and herbs.
A pebbly or sandy shore.
Moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in drops.
The perceptible natural movement of the air.
Atmospheric water vapor frozen into ice crystals.
A visible mass of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere.
A large area covered chiefly with trees and undergrowth.
The planet on which we live.
A very large expanse of sea.
The region of the atmosphere and outer space.
A series of connected vehicles that travel on tracks.
The act of traveling from one place to another.
